reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Programme National de Lutte contre le SIDA et les Infections Sexuellement Transmissibles

description.narrative: Burundi has a generalized HIV epidemic with concentrated sub-epidemics among high-risk populations. According to the Demographic and Health Survey conducted in 2010, the average prevalence of HIV in the adult population was 1.4%. According to the modes of transmission study (UNAIDS 2013), new HIV infections are particularly high among heterosexual couples, followed by sex workers (SW) and their clients, and men who have sex with men (MSM). Among TB patients, HIV prevalence is 15% (WHO 2013). This program is being implemented to ensure that the objectives of the National Strategic Plan for the fight against AIDS (2014-2017), such as achieving universal access to the prevention, treatment, care and support of persons infected and affected by HIV, are met by 2017. This will be achieved through strengthening the health and community systems, to ensure service delivery to vulnerable and affected populations. This Principal Recipient (PR) (Programme National de Lutte contre le SIDA) is a new PR that will focus on education and support at the community level, and trainings among vulnerable populations, including miners, prisoners, Batwa community and refugee leaders, to promote access to HIV and TB services, and increase awareness of gender-based violence. Burundi has received financial support from the Global Fund since 2003 that was implemented by previous PRs, through the Round 1, Round 5 and Round 8 grants.

title.narrative: TCS-other 2: Percentage of children currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
TCS-other 1: Percentage of adults currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
Percentage of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
TCS-other 5: Percentage of adults and children living with HIV enrolled in care having benefited from CD4 testing during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
TCS-other 3: Percentage of adults and children who are on antiretroviral treatment and how have benefited from viral load testing
TCS-other 4: Percentage of health facilities dispensing antiretroviral therapy without stock-outs for one or more required antiretroviral drug, for a period of 2 weeks, during each reporting period
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
